description: ... my vega 64 is detected as vega 56, and appears to have vega 56 power limits. i checked with both BIOSes and the power limit was never above 200-220 watts. Vega 64 power limit is 300 watts from memory? Not sure if this is a linux ism or an app issue.
summary: looks like a good start, however..

description: Brings over much of the functionality that you get from Wattman on Windows, provided you set the featuremask in GRUB.
It's not often I've come across GPU control software on Linux that works out of the box and is so intuitive.
I tested on AMD CPU Ryzen 3600 and 3700X and gives good results when adapting the profile for specific ways of working. To see the profile-specific result, use the "GtkStressTesting" application.
Works a lot like the Radeon control center. It even runs on Wayland naively(as Qt).
Havent come across such a functional temperature control app in Linux for my RX 580 GPU. Nice job!

I was thinking that I had to install windows after 5 years because I brought an AMD RYZEN 4000 series and I couldn't do nothing about the APU settings I was getting frustrated with any linux distros, but Fedora 33 guide me to this application and I'm super happy! Thank you, Thank you, Thank you very much to whom created this unbelievable tool! is there any way to support him???
summary: I'm Stunning finally we have this Amazing tools

description:
Works to manage my CPU speed on my Dell Inspiron 1525 laptop, would be 5* if it showed CPU temp and could manage fan speed too. 
Would be nice if it had options to mange the integrated video hardware, but i don think this laptop has that capability so i am not factoring this into my review.
summary: Works for managing CPU governing on Dell 1525

description: very good i love it thank you
summary: Amazing Linux is the best now
